title: Odisha FC : Odisha Eyeing Top Spot And Place In Last Four | Bhubaneswar News
body_text:
- News
- City News
- bhubaneswar News
- Odisha eyeing top spot and place in last four
Trending
This story is from January 17, 2024
The day’s opening clash will witness FC Goa and Bengaluru FC battling it out, in what promises to be one of the biggest matches of the tournament from the group stage.
Later in the day, Odisha FC will host Inter Kashi FC, each team driven by the distinct objectives to secure their pathway into the semifinals.
Odisha will hope to build on their winning momentum when they face Inter Kashi at the Kalinga Stadium Main Pitch.
Starting their campaign on a triumphant note, the Kalinga Warriors secured three hard-fought points against Bengaluru FC. However, their upcoming clash against Inter Kashi won’t be a walk in the park.
The I-League side displayed resilience against FC Goa, narrowly losing with a late winner from the Gaurs.
Gearing up for their second home game, Odisha FC will aim to make their fans proud with a repeat victory in the tournament they triumphed in the previous season.
Chennaiyin beat Gokulam:
Strikers Connor Shields and Irfan Yadwad struck a goal each in either half as Chennaiyin FC beat Gokulam Kerala FC 2-0 in the Super Cup Group C match at Kalinga Stadium in Bhubaneswar on Tuesday.Shields scored the opening goal in the 25th minute before substitute Yadwad netted the second in the 64th minute to hand Chennaiyin a crucial victory.
Manisha wins 1st point for Sports Odisha:
Manisha Naik scored in the 85th minute to salvage a draw against HOPS FC and earn Sports Odisha their first point of the IWL season at the Capital Football Arena in Bhubaneswar on Tuesday.
We also published the following articles recently
Odisha FC look for a winning start to title defence in Super Cup
Bengaluru FC coach Zaragoza called Group D the 'Group of Death' due to all the coaches being Spanish. FC Goa will face Inter Kashi in the afternoon game, while Odisha FC will play against Bengaluru in the evening. Odisha FC, with their unbeaten run this season and home advantage, are favorites to secure an AFC Champions League spot.
